author: WEAR Staff
title: chevron-right
text: {p}HEADLINE: Nice start to the new year{/p}{p}LOW TODAY: 42{ } { }NORMAL LOW: 39{/p}{p}HIGH TODAY: 59 NORMAL HIGH: 56{/p}{p}Not a bad way to close out 2023 with another ALMOST 60 degree day.{/p}{p}Clouds have arrived, but nothing to squeeze out of them, so your New Year's Eve forecast remains dry.{/p}{p}Temperatures by midnight tonight with hover near the 50 degree mark under mostly cloudy skies.{/p}{p}New Year's Day looks great with partly cloudy skies and mild temperatures. Look for a high near 60 once again.{/p}{p}A quick moving storm system will arrive late Wednesday with a good chance for showers and mountain snow through early Thursday morning.{/p}{p}Rainfall amounts for the valley will range from .10\" to .25\".{/p}{p}Snowfall, above 8,000 feet, will range from 4 to 8\" especially in the Spring Mountains. I expect a Winter Weather Advisory to be issued by the National Weather Service so stay tuned for more updates.{/p}{p}High temperatures will also come crashing down into the lower 50s by Thursday.{/p}{p}Another winter storm is on track for next weekend so stay tuned!{/p}{p}CURRENT SNOWPACK: UPPER COLORADO RIVER BASIN - 71% (115% last year at this time){/p}{p}LAKE MEAD TRACKER: Lake mead is currently at 1068 feet compared to 1044 feet one year ago today.{/p}{p}Total valley rainfall in 2023: 4.59\" (+0.41\" above normal){/p}{p}Total valley rainfall through December 31st, 2022: 2.13\" (-1.95\" below normal){/p}{p}AIR QUALITY - HEALTHY{/p}{p}-Bill Bellis{/p}{p}A Florida man was arrested after he tried to kidnap a 4-year-old boy at a Walmart on Friday, according to the Lee County Sheriff's Office.{/p}{p}Pablo Pintueles Hernandez, 64, is charged with false imprisonment of a child 13 years old and under.{/p}{p}{sd-embed class=\"sd-embedded-media\" data-alt=\"Would-be%20kidnapper%20in%20Walmart%20grabbed%204-year-old's%20wrist,%20told%20him%20'Let's%20go,'%20deputies%20say\" data-caption=\"Store%20surveillance%20showed%20Pablo%20Pintueles%20Hernandez%20allegedly%20pulling%20the%204-year-old%20by%20his%20wrist,%20and%20the%20child's%20family%20quickly%20intervening.%20Video%20ends%20with%20his%20arrest,%20Dec.%2029,%202023.%20(Lee%20Co.%20Sheriff's%20Office)\" data-embed-type=\"video\" embed}{/p}{p}The incident was caught on camera at the Walmart in Lehigh Acres.{br}{/p}{p}Deputies say the boy was shopping with his family when Pintueles Hernandez walked up to the child, grabbed his wrist, said \"Let's go,\" and began walking away with him. However, the child's family quickly intervened and pulled him away from Pintueles Hernandez.{/p}{p}Pintueles Hernandez then walked away and left the store.{/p}{blockQuote: }\"Deputies tirelessly worked alongside our Real Time Intelligence Center Analysts to identify the suspect,\" the sheriff's office says. \"Together, analysts and deputies utilized advanced technology to quickly identify and locate Pintueles Hernandez. Within an hour of the incident, deputies responded to the residence of Pintueles Hernandez where his identity was confirmed.\"{/blockQuote: }{p}Pintueles Hernandez was booked into jail early Saturday morning and released a day later on $100,000 bond.{/p}{blockQuote: }\"What this criminal did is incredibly disturbing,\" stated Sheriff Carmine Marceno. \"I never want anyone in Lee County to feel unsafe, especially going on a simple shopping trip. My team will stop at NOTHING to ensure criminals like this face the consequences of their actions.\"{/blockQuote: }{p}HEADLINE: Nice start to the new year{/p}{p}LOW TODAY: 42{ } { }NORMAL LOW: 39{/p}{p}HIGH TODAY: 59 NORMAL HIGH: 56{/p}{p}Not a bad way to close out 2023 with another ALMOST 60 degree day.{/p}{p}Clouds have arrived, but nothing to squeeze out of them, so your New Year's Eve forecast remains dry.{/p}{p}Temperatures by midnight tonight with hover near the 50 degree mark under mostly cloudy skies.{/p}{p}New Year's Day looks great with partly cloudy skies and mild temperatures. Look for a high near 60 once again.{/p}{p}A quick moving storm system will arrive late Wednesday with a good chance for showers and mountain snow through early Thursday morning.{/p}{p}Rainfall amounts for the valley will range from .10\" to .25\".{/p}{p}Snowfall, above 8,000 feet, will range from 4 to 8\" especially in the Spring Mountains. I expect a Winter Weather Advisory to be issued by the National Weather Service so stay tuned for more updates.{/p}{p}High temperatures will also come crashing down into the lower 50s by Thursday.{/p}{p}Another winter storm is on track for next weekend so stay tuned!{/p}{p}CURRENT SNOWPACK: UPPER COLORADO RIVER BASIN - 71% (115% last year at this time){/p}{p}LAKE MEAD TRACKER: Lake mead is currently at 1068 feet compared to 1044 feet one year ago today.{/p}{p}Total valley rainfall in 2023: 4.59\" (+0.41\" above normal){/p}{p}Total valley rainfall through December 31st, 2022: 2.13\" (-1.95\" below normal){/p}{p}AIR QUALITY - HEALTHY{/p}{p}-Bill Bellis{/p}{p}A Florida man was arrested after he tried to kidnap a 4-year-old boy at a Walmart on Friday, according to the Lee County Sheriff's Office.{/p}{p}Pablo Pintueles Hernandez, 64, is charged with false imprisonment of a child 13 years old and under.{/p}{p}{sd-embed class=\"sd-embedded-media\" data-embed-type=\"video\" embed}{/p}{p}The incident was caught on camera at the Walmart in Lehigh Acres.{br}{/p}{p}Deputies say the boy was shopping with his family when Pintueles Hernandez walked up to the child, grabbed his wrist, said \"Let's go,\" and began walking away with him. However, the child's family quickly intervened and pulled him away from Pintueles Hernandez.{/p}{p}Pintueles Hernandez then walked away and left the store.{/p}{blockQuote: }\"Deputies tirelessly worked alongside our Real Time Intelligence Center Analysts to identify the suspect,\" the sheriff's office says. \"Together, analysts and deputies utilized advanced technology to quickly identify and locate Pintueles Hernandez. Within an hour of the incident, deputies responded to the residence of Pintueles Hernandez where his identity was confirmed.\"{/blockQuote: }{p}Pintueles Hernandez was booked into jail early Saturday morning and released a day later on $100,000 bond.{/p}{blockQuote: }\"What this criminal did is incredibly disturbing,\" stated Sheriff Carmine Marceno. \"I never want anyone in Lee County to feel unsafe, especially going on a simple shopping trip. My team will stop at NOTHING to ensure criminals like this face the consequences of their actions.\"{/blockQuote: }
